comments: a(n) is the weighted sum over all derangements (permutations with no fixed points) of n elements where each permutation with an odd number of cycles has weight +1 and each with an even number of cycles has weight -1. [_Michael Somos_, Jan 19 2011]

Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-1).
formula: E.g.f.: (1-x)*exp(x).a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} A094816(n,k)*(-1)^k (alternating row sums of Poisson-Charlier coefficient matrix).O.g.f.: (1-2*x)/(1-x)^2. a(n+1) = A001489(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, May 28 2008a(n) = 2*a(n-1)-a(n-2) for n>1. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 02 2016
example: a(4) = -3 because there are 6 derangements with one 4-cycle with weight -1 and 3 derangements with two 2-cycles with weight +1. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 19 2011
